intro: Psilotrichum leptostachys, commonly known as the slender-stalked clubmoss, is a member of the family Lycopodiaceae. It is a small, evergreen plant that typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forests and rocky soils. The plant has a short, upright stem with whorled leaves that are linear and tapering. It produces small, spore-bearing structures called strobili at the tips of its branches. This species is notable for its primitive morphology and is often found in temperate regions of Asia and North America.
